content.p: JFreeCiv is a Java clone of FreeCiv, an open source version of the immensely popular strategy game Civilization.

The freeciv java port was originally developed by Artur Abies, I spent a furious couple of weeks hacking the source to attempt to upgrade it to support Freeciv 1.10.0 about a year ago, which resulted in rewriting various parts of the client and networking code. It has never been in an entirely playable state.

Currently (July 2001), I'm working on updating the client to support the forthcoming 1.12.0 release of Freeciv. I've basically got back to where I was with 1.10.0 but can now connect to a server compiled from a recent CVS snapshot of 1.11.7-devel.

If you want to see what I've been working on recently, as well as an overview of the current status, have a look at the
Changelog.
A binary distribution of JFreeCiv is not yet available. A source code snapshot is available on request, but the preferred method of getting the code is to check it out from cvs.
The code is in the jfreeciv module on the dubh.org cvs server. Details on accessing and downloading the code is available from http://cvs.dubh.org.
